page.title: 10Margam Park. The Orangery
page.content: Arguably the finest example of late 18th century architecture in South Wales, it was built for T.M.Talbot to house a collection of trees acquired in the previous century. Designed also as a gallery for statuary collected on the 'Grand Tour', only that of LUCIUS VERUS an obscure Roman Emperor remains. Prior to purchase by West Glamorgan County Council in 1973 the building was in a poor state of repair and was subject to two years restoration. The Georgian hypocaust was abandoned with the result that orange trees recently imported from Florida no longer flourish but are grown in the Citrus House. Restored as part function room, part Orangery it provides a venue for the Margam Music Festival, exhibitions and social functions.
